tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: By his very nature he wants anyone indulging in evil to be punished and anyone doing righteous deeds to be rewarded. This faculty bears testimony at the psychological level to the reality of the world of the Hereafter
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What key concept does this verse highlight?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: To make a point of seeking out that portion of the Quran for which he has not yet been made accountable, is being over-hasty and is entirely against Quranic wisdom
distractors: This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse narrates a historical event
This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: There is only one reason for neglect of the Hereafter and that is the desire to obtain an immediate reward for all one’s striving (kalla bal tuhibbuna’l ‘ajilah)
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: Which concept is emphasized in Surah Al-Qiyamah, Ayah 31?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: So, the system of nature which brings about such wonders every day, the creation of a new world after the present world should not be difficult. The fact is that the real impediment in the way of acceptance of Truth is egotism or conceit and not any dearth of arguments or reasoning
distractors: This verse narrates a historical event
This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
